job.title: Postgres Development DBA - Remote
job.description:
About Us
Since 2007, Webgility has helped over 10,000 companies with ecommerce automation. Today, we are the #1 automation software for QuickBooks & NetSuite retailers. Business is booming, and we’re growing at warp speed!
Our Mission
Empower small & medium-sized enterprises to thrive in ecommerce. We integrate their systems, automate their operations & deliver powerful insights so they can move faster, make better decisions and win!
Our Core Values
Keep it real.
We do amazing work but we're humble, transparent, and accountable. If we make mistakes, we own up and always keep it real. No egos, please.
Stay curious.
No matter what we're working on, we give it our 100%. We're always learning and feel connected to our team and our customers.
Lead with data.
We focus on results, not activity. We understand—both for ourselves and our customers—that data and software are key. We use them both so our work creates real impact.
Win as a team.
We come for the job and stay for the people. We love good food and drink. There are always laughs to be had, whether a budget meeting or a bowling party.
Enjoy the journey. Our customers often tell us that our software has changed their lives. We want to change the face of the ecommerce industry by helping businesses easily run back-office operations.
As a development DBA for Webgility, you will:
Design stable, reliable and effective databases
Collaborate with a team of world-class developers on their design decisions, giving advice on performance and writing good SQL
Prepare deployment scripts and produce deployment plans
Prepare rollback scripts and produce rollback plans
Provide administration of development, testing and staging servers
Offer consulting on optimal architecture and data models
Determine, enforce and document database policies, procedures and standards
Perform business requirement analysis with PM
Create and manage schema documentation and other technical artifacts relating to development
Work cross-team with other co-located teams, remote teams, and external partner companies
Required Job Skills and Experience
4+ years work experience as a Database developer building commercial software
BS Degree in Computer Science, Electrical & Computer Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent job experience
Extensive experience with PostgreSQL
In-depth understanding of data management (e.g. permissions, recovery, security and monitoring)
Extensive experience working with agile sprint teams to collaborate
Excellent analytical and organization skills
An ability to understand front-end users requirements and a problem-solving attitude
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Research and suggest new database products, services and protocols
Other Requirements
Must be a US citizen or authorized to work in the US. Visa sponsorship currently not available.
Deep Thoughts
Be a part of something bigger with more opportunity and ownership of innovative ecommerce solutions. Ecommerce continues to grow at record speeds and you can help disrupt the market. Did you know? In the time it took you to read this, there were 200,000 searches on eBay and over 45,000 autonomous robots now roam Amazon warehouses in search of their next package.
